alert.note: Alert for Leavenworth; Wyandotte (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 9:33PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wyandotte, Leavenworth, southeastern Buchanan, southwestern Clinton, northern Clay and Platte Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 933 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lansing, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Leavenworth, Liberty, Gladstone, Lansing, Smithville, Kearney, Bonner Springs, Parkville, Tonganoxie, Platte City, Basehor, Edwardsville, Riverside, Weatherby Lake, Weston, Kansas City, Lake Waukomis, Trimble, Edgerton and Camden Point. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 410 and 413. Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 17 and 27. Interstate 29 between mile markers 3 and 28. Interstate 635 near mile marker 12. Interstate 435 between mile markers 12 and 49. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 206 and 226. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northwestern Missouri.
